name: Rosemary and Garlic Simmered Pork Chops
author: Jen
summary: I was looking for something easy and tasty to make with the remaining ingredients in my apartment and this is what I came up with.
ingredients: 4 (6 ounce) boneless center-cut pork loin chops, trimmed of fat
directions: In a small bowl, combine rosemary, ground pepper, and salt; rub rosemary mixture on pork chops
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat; stir the garlic into the melted butter, then place the pork chops in the skillet
Cook the pork chops 3 to 5 minutes per side, or until golden brown

Turn the heat down to low, pour in the beef broth, and simmer for 35 to 45 minutes, or until pork chops are fully cooked and meat thermometer inserted into thickest chop reads 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
